direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are fundamental for object comparison and have similar structural patterns in their implementation.
Both methods involve checking the presence of a key in the map, though they serve different purposes.
Both methods involve checking the presence of an element in the map, though they operate on different types of elements.
Both methods access the map's internal structure to retrieve or check for the presence of elements.
Both methods modify the state of the map by either removing an element or changing its internal structure.

enhanced_by.reason: Initialization of the map is required before performing any operations, including equals.
Adding elements to the map can affect the result of the equals method.
Removing elements from the map can affect the result of the equals method.
The result of containsKey can be used to assert the state of the map after an equals operation.
The result of containsValue can be used to assert the state of the map after an equals operation.
